name: Expeditor
description:
KAZ Minerals Russia is currently looking for an Expeditor.

Structural division: Procurement Department

Reports to: Senior Expeditor

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Higher education, IPMA-certification is an advantage;
  • Min. 5 years’ experience in mining would be an advantage (as well as in oil & gas industry, in procurement and expediting department);
  • Thorough understanding of the Russian and International Supplier Base and contacts within Projects, Mining background or mine site exposure;
  • Proven, successful experience in Supply Chain function(s);
  • Regional awareness through experience working with other cultures and people;
  • Possess high ethical and professional standards in all dealings;
  • Desired experience with monitoring fabrication, plus engineering exposure;
  • Proficiency in business English and Russian;
  • Pays close attention to details;
  • Possess high ethical and professional standards in all dealings;
  • Proficiency: Full MS Suite (MS Excel, Word & Power Point required and Access) and Oracle preferred.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Reports to and supports SNEX on expediting matters;
  • Expedites acknowledgement and execution of orders;
  • Supports SNEX in preparation of the Procurement Weekly and Monthly Status Reports, plus Supplier Progress Report, and other regular reports that may be required;
  • Attends regular Expediting and Inspection Meetings and actions any departure from Supplier's Programs, if required;
  • Expedites Supplier's and Sub-Supplier's by monitoring physical progress to ensure timely deliveries to site;
  • Identify, calculate and notify SNEX, Buyer and PM of potential and current Liquidated Damages that may be claimed from Suppliers due to delay in supply of VDDRs and/or Materials;
  • Issues Release Certificates on acceptance of equipment/material;
  • Shall become familiar with the Project Expediting Procedures and Project Interfaces;
  • Is fully conversant with contents of Purchase Order/Sub-Contract;
  • Interfaces with Project Team Members;
  • Witnesses (or arranges 3rd parties for) loading of equipment prior to dispatch to site, if required;
  • Creating Expediting files for all major and critical orders;
  • Supporting SNEX in maintaining a master file system to be in line with project requirements;
  • Schedule and hold Pre-Award and Kick-Off meetings with major suppliers;
  • Prioritize focus on critical Vendor Data and first submissions, ITPs & WPSs to avoid delays;
  • Monitor project design, engineering progress and manufacturing start dates;
  • Assist construction and planning with installation planning and requirements;
  • Identify and alert Project Management on technical issues and schedule delays;
  • Obtain from vendor full itemization on sub-orders critical to the schedule;
  • Liaise closely with Logistics to advise on delivery schedule in advance of estimated dates;
  • Maintain status report within ERP/tracking system for regular review to identify priority items;
  • Input data into ERP/tracking system to stay up-to-date with delivery status;
  • Report tracking on fabrication & assembly sequence, plus site construction activities.

CONDITIONS:

  • Regular work week (5 working days / 2 days off);
  • Location: Moscow;
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
